   20: -module(compile_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests compile:file/1 and compile:file/2 with various options.
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/erl_compile.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 app_test/1,appup_test/1,bigE_roundtrip/1,
   30: 	 debug_info/4, custom_debug_info/1, custom_compile_info/1,
   31: 	 file_1/1, forms_2/1, module_mismatch/1, outdir/1,
   32: 	 binary/1, makedep/1, cond_and_ifdef/1, listings/1, listings_big/1,
   33: 	 other_output/1, encrypted_abstr/1,
   34: 	 strict_record/1, utf8_atoms/1, utf8_functions/1, extra_chunks/1,
   35: 	 cover/1, env/1, core_pp/1, tuple_calls/1,
   36: 	 core_roundtrip/1, asm/1, asm_labels/1,
   37: 	 sys_pre_attributes/1, dialyzer/1, no_core_prepare/1,
   38: 	 warnings/1, pre_load_check/1, env_compiler_options/1,
   39:          bc_options/1, deterministic_include/1, deterministic_paths/1,
   40:          compile_attribute/1, message_printing/1, other_options/1,
   41:          transforms/1, erl_compile_api/1, types_pp/1, bs_init_writable/1,
   42:          annotations_pp/1
   43: 	]).
   44: 
   45: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   46: 
   47: %% To cover the stripping of 'type' and 'spec' in beam_asm.
   48: -type all_return_type() :: [atom()].
   49: -spec all() -> all_return_type().
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [app_test, appup_test, bigE_roundtrip, file_1,
   53:      forms_2, module_mismatch, outdir,
   54:      binary, makedep, cond_and_ifdef, listings, listings_big,
   55:      other_output, encrypted_abstr, tuple_calls,
   56:      strict_record, utf8_atoms, utf8_functions, extra_chunks,
   57:      cover, env, core_pp, core_roundtrip, asm, asm_labels, no_core_prepare,
   58:      sys_pre_attributes, dialyzer, warnings, pre_load_check,
   59:      env_compiler_options, custom_debug_info, bc_options,
   60:      custom_compile_info, deterministic_include, deterministic_paths,
   61:      compile_attribute, message_printing, other_options, transforms,
   62:      erl_compile_api, types_pp, bs_init_writable, annotations_pp].
   63: 
   64: groups() -> 
   65:     [].
   66: 
   67: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   68:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   75: 	Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   78: 	Config.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: 
   82: %% Test that the Application file has no `basic' errors.";
   83: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     test_server:app_test(compiler).
   85: 
   86: %% Test that the Application upgrade file has no `basic' errors.";
   87: appup_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   88:     ok = test_server:appup_test(compiler).
   89: 
   90: %% Check that a file compiled to the abstract form and dumped with -E
   91: %% can be compiled. We use a file constructed to produce errors if the
   92: %% dumping fails to legalize compiler generated variable names.
   93: bigE_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   94:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   95:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   96:     Source = filename:join(DataDir, "bigE.erl"),
   97:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bigE"),
   98:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.E"),
   99:     TargetSource = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.erl"),
  100:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  101:     io:format("Source: ~p~nTargetDir: ~p~nTarget: ~p\n",
  102:               [Source, TargetDir, Target]),
  103:     case compile:file(Source,
  104:                       ['E', warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  105:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  106:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  107:     end,
  108:     %% Rename the output to .erl so that the compiler accepts it and
  109:     %% we won't get a warning due to the filename not matching the
  110:     %% module name.
  111:     ok = file:rename(Target, TargetSource),
  112:     case compile:file(TargetSource,
  113:                       [warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  114:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  115:         Other1 -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other1})
  116:     end,
  117:     file:delete(TargetSource),
  118:     file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: %% Tests that we can compile and run a simple Erlang program,
  122: %% using compile:file/1.
  123: 
  124: file_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  125:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  126: 
  127:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  128:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  129: 
  130:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  131:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  132:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
  133: 
  134:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [slim]), %Smoke test only.
  135:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple),	%Smoke test only.
  136: 
  137:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, []),
  138:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [debug_info]),
  139:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [no_postopt]),
  140: 
  141:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [no_line_info]), %Coverage
  142:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{eprof,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  143: 
  144:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  145:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, no_postopt),
  146: 
  147:     %% Test compiling from an .abstr file.
  148:     {ok,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr]),
  149:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(filename:rootname(Target), [from_abstr]),
  150:     ok = file:delete(filename:rootname(Target) ++ ".abstr"),
  151: 
  152:     %% Test option 'deterministic'.
  153:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [deterministic]),
  154:     {module,simple} = c:l(simple),
  155:     [{version,_}] = simple:module_info(compile),
  156:     true = code:delete(simple),
  157:     false = code:purge(simple),
  158: 
  159:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
  160:     true = exists(Target),
  161:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  162: 
  163:     %% Test option 'deterministic' as a compiler attribute.
  164:     Det = deterministic_module,
  165:     {DetPath, DetTarget} = get_files(Config, Det, "det_target"),
  166:     {ok,Det,DetCode} = compile:file(DetPath, [binary]),
  167:     {module,Det} = code:load_binary(Det, "", DetCode),
  168:     [{version,_}] = Det:module_info(compile),
  169:     true = code:delete(Det),
  170:     false = code:purge(Det),
  171: 
  172:     %% Cover error handling code.
  173:     NonExisting = definitely__no__such__module,
  174:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [report]),
  175:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_abstr,report]),
  176:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_core,report]),
  177:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_asm,report]),
  178: 
  179:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core"), [from_core,report]),
  180:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core_tokens"), [from_core,report]),
  181: 
  182:     %% Cover handling of obsolete options.
  183:     ObsoleteOptions = [r18,r19,r20,r21,r22,r23,
  184:                        no_bsm3,no_get_hd_tl,no_put_tuple2,no_utf8_atoms,
  185:                        no_swap,no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_make_fun3],
  186:     _ = [begin
  187:              {error,[{_Simple,
  188:                       [{none,compile,{obsolete_option,Opt}}]}],
  189:               []} =
  190:                  compile:file(Simple, [Opt,return]),
  191:              error = compile:file(Simple, [Opt,report])
  192:          end || Opt <- ObsoleteOptions],
  193: 
  194:     %% Create a directory with the same name as the temp file to cover
  195:     %% handling of write errors.
  196:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  197:     SimpleTempFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.bea#"),
  198:     SimpleOutputFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam"),
  199:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  200:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleOutputFile),
  201:     try
  202:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report]),
  203:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  204:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  205:     after
  206:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  207:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleOutputFile)
  208:     end,
  209: 
  210:     %% Cleanup.
  211:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  212:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  213:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(DetTarget)),
  214: 
  215:     %% There should not be any messages in the messages.
  216:     receive
  217: 	Any ->
  218: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
  219:     after 10 ->
  220: 	    ok
  221:     end,
  222: 
  223:     ok.
  224: 
  225: forms_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  227:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  228: 
  229:     Src = Simple,
  230:     AbsSrc = filename:absname(Src),
  231:     {ok,[],SimpleCode} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr,binary]),
  232: 
  233:     {ok,simple,Bin1} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [binary,{source,Src}]),
  234:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode,
  235:                                   [binary,{error_location,line},{source,Src}]),
  236: 
  237:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  238:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, no_postopt),
  239: 
  240:     %% Load and test that the proper source is returned.
  241:     AbsSrc = forms_load_code(simple, Src, Bin1),
  242: 
  243:     %% Work in a deleted directory.
  244:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  245:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  246:     ok = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  247:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  248:     case os:type() of
  249: 	{unix,_} -> os:cmd("rm -rf " ++ WorkDir);
  250: 	_ -> ok
  251:     end,
  252:     {ok,simple,Bin2} = compile:forms(SimpleCode),
  253:     undefined = forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin2),
  254: 
  255:     {ok,simple,Bin3} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [{source,Src},report]),
  256:     case forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin3) of
  257: 	Src ->					%Unix.
  258: 	    ok;
  259: 	AbsSrc ->				%Windows.
  260: 	    ok
  261:     end,
  262: 
  263:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_core0,binary]),
  264:     forms_compile_and_load(Core, [from_core]),
  265: 
  266:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_asm,binary]),
  267:     forms_compile_and_load(Asm, [from_asm]),
  268: 
  269:     %% The `from_abstr` option is redundant when compiling from forms,
  270:     %% but it should work.
  271:     forms_compile_and_load(SimpleCode, [from_abstr]),
  272: 
  273:     %% Cover the error handling code.
  274:     error = compile:forms(bad_core, [from_core,report]),
  275:     error = compile:forms(bad_asm, [from_asm,report]),
  276: 
  277:     ok.
  278: 
  279: 
  280: forms_load_code(Mod, Src, Bin) ->
  281:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Src, Bin),
  282:     Info = Mod:module_info(compile),
  283:     SourceOption = proplists:get_value(source, Info),
  284: 
  285:     %% Ensure that the options are not polluted with 'source'.
  286:     [] = proplists:get_value(options, Info),
  287: 
  288:     %% Cleanup.
  289:     true = code:delete(simple),
  290:     false = code:purge(simple),
  291: 
  292:     SourceOption.
  293: 
  294: forms_compile_and_load(Code, Opts) ->
  295:     Mod = simple,
  296:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Code, Opts),
  297:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "ignore", Bin),
  298:     _ = Mod:module_info(),
  299:     true = code:delete(simple),
  300:     false = code:purge(simple),
  301:     ok.
  302: 
  303: module_mismatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  305:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "wrong_module_name.erl"),
  306:     {error,[{"wrong_module_name.beam",
  307: 	     [{none,compile,{module_name,arne,"wrong_module_name"}}]}],
  308: 	   []} = compile:file(File, [return]),
  309:     error = compile:file(File, [report]),
  310: 
  311:     {ok,arne,[]} = compile:file(File,
  312: 				      [return,no_error_module_mismatch]),
  313: 
  314:     ok.
  315: 
  316: %% Tests that the {outdir, Dir} option works.
  317: 
  318: outdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  319:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "outdir"),
  320:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)}]),
  321:     true = exists(Target),
  322:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  323:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  324:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  325:     ok.
  326: 
  327: %% Tests that the binary option works.
  328: 
  329: binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  330:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "binary"),
  331:     {ok, simple, Binary} = compile:file(Simple, [binary]),
  332:     code:load_binary(simple, Target, Binary),
  333:     passed = simple:test(),
  334:     true = code:delete(simple),
  335:     false = code:purge(simple),
  336:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  337:     ok.
  338: 
  339: %% Tests that the dependencies-Makefile-related options work.
  340: 
  341: makedep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  343:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  344: 
  345:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "makedep"),
  346:     SimpleRootname = filename:rootname(Simple),
  347:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  348:     IncludeOptions = [
  349: 		      {d,need_foo},
  350: 		      {d,foo_value,42},
  351: 		      {d,include_generated},
  352: 		      {i,IncludeDir}
  353: 		     ],
  354: 
  355:     %% Basic rule.
  356:     BasicMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic1.mk",
  357:     {ok,BasicMf1} = file:read_file(BasicMf1Name),
  358:     {ok,_,Mf1} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep]),
  359:     BasicMf1 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf1, DataDir),
  360: 
  361:     %% Basic rule with one existing header.
  362:     BasicMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic2.mk",
  363:     {ok,BasicMf2} = file:read_file(BasicMf2Name),
  364:     {ok,_,Mf2} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  365:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf2, DataDir),
  366: 
  367:     %% Rule with one existing header and one missing header.
  368:     MissingMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-missing.mk",
  369:     {ok,MissingMf} = file:read_file(MissingMfName),
  370:     {ok,_,Mf3} = compile:file(Simple,
  371:       [binary,makedep,makedep_add_missing|IncludeOptions]),
  372:     MissingMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf3, DataDir),
  373: 
  374:     %% Rule with modified target.
  375:     TargetMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target1.mk",
  376:     {ok,TargetMf1} = file:read_file(TargetMf1Name),
  377:     {ok,_,Mf4} = compile:file(Simple,
  378:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"}|IncludeOptions]),
  379:     TargetMf1 = makedep_modify_target(
  380:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf4, DataDir), "$$target"),
  381: 
  382:     %% Rule with quoted modified target.
  383:     TargetMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target2.mk",
  384:     {ok,TargetMf2} = file:read_file(TargetMf2Name),
  385:     {ok,_,Mf5} = compile:file(Simple,
  386:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"},makedep_quote_target|
  387:         IncludeOptions]),
  388:     TargetMf2 = makedep_modify_target(
  389:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf5, DataDir), "$$target"),
  390: 
  391:     %% Basic rule written to some file.
  392:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple,
  393:       [makedep,{makedep_output,Target}|IncludeOptions]),
  394:     {ok,Mf6} = file:read_file(Target),
  395:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf6, DataDir),
  396: 
  397:     %% Rule with creating phony target.
  398:     PhonyMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-phony.mk",
  399:     {ok,PhonyMf} = file:read_file(PhonyMfName),
  400:     {ok,_,Mf7} = compile:file(Simple,
  401:       [binary,makedep,makedep_phony|IncludeOptions]),
  402:     PhonyMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf7, DataDir),
  403: 
  404:     %% Basic rule written to the default file.
  405:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  406:     {ok,Mf8} = file:read_file(Target),
  407:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf8, DataDir),
  408: 
  409:     %% Generate dependencies and compile normally at the same time.
  410:     GeneratedHrl = filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"),
  411:     ok = file:write_file(GeneratedHrl, ""),
  412:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  413:                                         {makedep_output,Target},
  414:                                         {i,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  415:     {ok,Mf9} = file:read_file(Target),
  416:     BasicMf3 = iolist_to_binary([string:trim(BasicMf2), " ", filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"), "\n"]),
  417:     BasicMf3 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf9, DataDir),
  418:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  419:                                   {makedep_output,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  420: 
  421:     %% Cover generation of long lines that must be split.
  422:     CompileModule = filename:join(code:lib_dir(compiler), "src/compile.erl"),
  423:     {ok,_} = compile:file(CompileModule, [report,
  424:                                           makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io},
  425:                                           {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}]),
  426: 
  427:     %% Basic rule written to the standard output.
  428:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io}|IncludeOptions]),
  429: 
  430:     %% Test error handling.
  431:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,DataDir}]),
  432:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,a_bad_output_device}]),
  433: 
  434:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  435:     ok = file:delete(GeneratedHrl),
  436:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  437:     ok.
  438: 
  439: makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf, DataDir) ->
  440:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  441:     %% Replace the Datadir by "$(srcdir)".
  442:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, DataDir, "$(srcdir)/",
  443:       [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  444:     %% Long lines are split, put back everything on one line.
  445:     Mf2 = re:replace(Mf1, "\\\\\n  ", "", [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  446:     list_to_binary(Mf2).
  447: 
  448: makedep_modify_target(Mf, Target) ->
  449:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  450:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, Target, "$target", [{return,list}]),
  451:     list_to_binary(Mf1).
  452: 
  453: %% Tests that conditional compilation, defining values, including files work.
  454: 
  455: no_core_prepare(_Config) ->
  456:     Mod = {c_module,[],
  457:               {c_literal,[],sample_receive},
  458:               [{c_var,[],{discard,0}}],
  459:               [],
  460:               [{{c_var,[],{discard,0}},
  461:                 {c_fun,[],[],
  462:                     {c_case,[],
  463:                         {c_values,[],[]},
  464:                         [{c_clause,[],[],
  465:                              {c_literal,[],true},
  466:                              {c_receive,[],[],{c_literal,[],0},{c_literal,[],ok}}}]}}}]},
  467: 
  468:     {ok,sample_receive,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return]),
  469:     {error,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return,no_core_prepare]),
  470:     ok.
  471: 
  472: cond_and_ifdef(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  473:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "cond_and_ifdef"),
  474:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  475:     Options = [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)},
  476: 		     {d, need_foo}, {d, foo_value, 42},
  477: 		     {i, IncludeDir}, report],
  478:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, Options),
  479:     true = exists(Target),
  480:     {hiker, 42} = run(Target, foo, []),
  481:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  482:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  483:     ok.
  484: 
  485: listings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  487:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  488:     ok = do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [
  489: 	    "simple",
  490: 	    "small",
  491: 	    "small_maps"
  492: 	]),
  493: 
  494:     %% Cover handling of write errors.
  495:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  496:     SimpleTarget = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
  497:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTarget),
  498:     try
  499:         error = compile:file(Simple, ['S', {outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  500:     after
  501:         ok = file:del_dir(SimpleTarget)
  502:     end,
  503: 
  504:     ok.
  505: 
  506: do_file_listings(_, _, []) -> ok;
  507: do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [File|Files]) ->
  508:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  509:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, listings),
  510:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  511: 
  512:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  513:             {'E',".E"},
  514:             {'P',".P"},
  515:             {dpp, ".pp"},
  516:             {dabstr, ".abstr"},
  517:             {dexp, ".expand"},
  518:             {dcore, ".core"},
  519:             {doldinline, ".oldinline"},
  520:             {dinline, ".inline"},
  521:             {dcore, ".core"},
  522:             {dcopt, ".copt"},
  523:             {dcbsm, ".core_bsm"},
  524:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  525:             {dbool, ".bool"},
  526:             {dssashare, ".ssashare"},
  527:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  528:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  529:             {dcg, ".codegen"},
  530:             {dblk, ".block"},
  531:             {djmp, ".jump"},
  532:             {dclean, ".clean"},
  533:             {dopt, ".optimize"},
  534:             {diffable, ".S"}],
  535:     p_listings(List, Simple, TargetDir),
  536: 
  537:     %% Test options that produce a listing file if 'binary' is not given.
  538:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_pp, ".P"),
  539:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_exp, ".E"),
  540:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core0, ".core"),
  541:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(TargetDir, File ++ ".core")),
  542:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core, ".core"),
  543:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_dis, ".dis"),
  544: 
  545:     %% Final clean up.
  546:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  547: 	filelib:wildcard(filename:join(TargetDir, "*"))),
  548:     ok = file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  549: 
  550:     do_file_listings(DataDir,PrivDir,Files).
  551: 
  552: listings_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  553:     {Big,Target} = get_files(Config, big, listings_big),
  554:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  555:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  556:             {'E',".E"},
  557:             {'P',".P"},
  558:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  559:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  560:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  561:             {to_dis, ".dis"}],
  562:     p_listings(List, Big, TargetDir).
  563: 
  564: p_listings(List, File, BaseDir) ->
  565:     Run = fun({Option,Extension}) ->
  566:                   Uniq = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  567:                   Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, integer_to_list(Uniq)),
  568:                   ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  569:                   try
  570:                       do_listing(File, Dir, Option, Extension),
  571:                       ok
  572:                   catch
  573:                       Class:Error:Stk ->
  574:                           io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Error,Stk]),
  575:                           error
  576:                   after
  577:                       _ = [ok = file:delete(F) ||
  578:                               F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))],
  579:                       ok = file:del_dir(Dir)
  580:                   end
  581:           end,
  582:     test_lib:p_run(Run, List).
  583: 
  584: other_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     {Simple,_Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "other_output"),
  586: 
  587:     io:put_chars("to_pp"),
  588:     {ok,[],PP} = compile:file(Simple, [to_pp,binary,time]),
  589:     [] = [E || E <- PP,
  590: 	       begin
  591: 		   case element(1, E) of
  592: 		       attribute -> false;
  593: 		       function -> false;
  594: 		       eof -> false
  595: 		   end
  596: 	       end],
  597: 
  598:     io:put_chars("to_exp (file)"),
  599:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:file(Simple, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  600:     true = is_list(Expand),
  601:     {attribute,_,module,simple} = lists:keyfind(module, 3, Expand),
  602:     io:put_chars("to_exp (forms)"),
  603:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:forms(PP, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  604: 
  605:     io:put_chars("to_core (file)"),
  606:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:file(Simple, [to_core,binary,time]),
  607:     c_module = element(1, Core),
  608:     {ok,_} = core_lint:module(Core),
  609:     io:put_chars("to_core (forms)"),
  610:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(PP, [to_core,binary,time]),
  611: 
  612:     io:put_chars("to_asm (file)"),
  613:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:file(Simple, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  614:     {simple,_,_,_,_} = Asm,
  615:     io:put_chars("to_asm (forms)"),
  616:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(PP, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  617: 
  618:     ok.
  619: 
  620: encrypted_abstr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  621:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "encrypted_abstr"),
  622: 
  623:     Res = case has_crypto() of
  624: 	      false ->
  625: 		  %% No crypto.
  626: 		  encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target),
  627: 		  {comment,"The crypto application is missing or broken"};
  628: 	      true ->
  629: 		  %% Simulate not having crypto by removing
  630: 		  %% the crypto application from the path.
  631: 		  OldPath = code:get_path(),
  632: 		  try
  633: 		      NewPath = OldPath -- [filename:dirname(code:which(crypto))],
  634: 		      (catch crypto:stop()),
  635: 		      code:delete(crypto),
  636: 		      code:purge(crypto),
  637: 		      code:set_path(NewPath),
  638: 		      encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target)
  639: 		      after
  640: 			  code:set_path(OldPath)
  641: 		      end,
  642: 
  643: 		  %% Now run the tests that require crypto.
  644: 		  encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target),
  645: 		  ok = file:delete(Target),
  646: 		  _ = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Target))
  647: 	  end,
  648:     
  649:     %% Cleanup.
  650:     Res.
  651: 
  652: encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target) ->
  653:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  654:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  655:     install_crypto_key(Key),
  656:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  657: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  658: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  659:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  660: 
  661:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  662: 				     [{debug_info_key,Key},
  663: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  664:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  665: 
  666:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  667: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{des3_cbc,Key}},
  668: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  669:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  670: 
  671:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  672: 				     [{debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}},
  673: 				      {debug_info_key,Key},
  674: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  675:     verify_abstract(Target, ?MODULE),
  676: 
  677:     {ok,{simple,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} =
  678: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
  679:     {_,Opts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
  680:     {_,'********'} = lists:keyfind(debug_info_key, 1, Opts),
  681: 
  682:     %% Try some illegal forms of crypto keys.
  683:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  684: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,"ss"}},report]),
  685:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  686: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,1,"ss"}},report]),
  687:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  688: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,42},report]),
  689: 
  690:     beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  691: 
  692:     %% Test to place the crypto file on disk. The test is dependent on the
  693:     %% $HOME of the emulator, so we do this test in another node.
  694:     TestHome = filename:join(TargetDir, "home"),
  695:     filelib:ensure_dir(TestHome),
  696:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  697:                   {win32, _} ->
  698:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  699:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  700:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  701:                   _ ->
  702:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  703:               end,
  704: 
  705:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  706: 
  707:     erpc:call(
  708:       Node,
  709:       fun() ->
  710:               {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  711:               ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
  712: 
  713:               error = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  714: 
  715:               CWDKey = "better use another key here",
  716:               CWDFile = ".erlang.crypt",
  717:               XDGKey = "better use yet another key here",
  718:               XDGFile = filename:join(
  719:                           filename:basedir(user_config,"erlang"),
  720:                           ".erlang.crypt"),
  721:               HOMEKey = "better use the home key here",
  722:               HOMEFile = filename:join(TestHome,".erlang.crypt"),
  723: 
  724:               write_crypt_file(CWDFile, CWDKey),
  725:               write_crypt_file(XDGFile, XDGKey),
  726:               write_crypt_file(HOMEFile, HOMEKey),
  727: 
  728:               %% First we test that .erlang.crypt in cwd works
  729:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  730:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  731:               ok = file:delete(CWDFile),
  732:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  733: 
  734:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does **not** work
  735:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  736:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  737: 
  738:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does work
  739:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  740:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  741:               ok = file:delete(HOMEFile),
  742:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  743: 
  744:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does **not** work
  745:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  746:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  747: 
  748: 
  749:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does work
  750:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  751:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  752:               ok = file:delete(XDGFile),
  753: 
  754:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  755:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  756:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code])
  757: 
  758:       end),
  759: 
  760:     peer:stop(Peer),
  761: 
  762:     %% Test key compatibility by reading a BEAM file produced before
  763:     %% the update to the new crypto functions.
  764:     install_crypto_key("an old key"),
  765:     KeyCompat = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple),
  766: 			      "key_compatibility"),
  767:     {ok,{key_compatibility,[Chunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(KeyCompat,
  768: 						       [abstract_code]),
  769:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Chunk,
  770: 
  771:     ok.
  772: 
  773: write_crypt_file(File, Key) ->
  774:     Contents = ["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"],
  775:     io:format("~s: ~s\n", [File, Contents]),
  776:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(File),
  777:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents).
  778: 
  779: encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target) ->
  780:     io:format("simpe: ~p~n", [Simple]),
  781:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  782:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  783:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  784: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  785: 				{outdir,TargetDir},report]),
  786:     ok.
  787:     
  788: verify_abstract(Beam, Backend) ->
  789:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  790:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  791:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,Backend,_}} = Dbgi.
  792: 
  793: has_crypto() ->
  794:     try
  795: 	crypto:start(),
  796: 	crypto:stop(),
  797: 	true
  798:     catch
  799: 	error:_ -> false
  800:     end.
  801: 
  802: install_crypto_key(Key) ->
  803:     F = fun (init) -> ok;
  804: 	    ({debug_info,des3_cbc,_,_}) -> Key;
  805: 	    (clear) -> ok
  806: 	end,
  807:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F).
  808: 
  809: %% Miscellaneous tests, mainly to get better coverage.
  810: debug_info(erlang_v1, Module, ok, _Opts) ->
  811:     {ok, [Module]};
  812: debug_info(erlang_v1, _Module, error, _Opts) ->
  813:     {error, unknown_format}.
  814: 
  815: custom_debug_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  816:     {Simple,_} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  817: 
  818:     {ok,simple,OkBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}}]), %Coverage
  819:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,[simple]}}]}} =
  820: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [abstract_code]),
  821:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,ok}}]}} =
  822: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [debug_info]),
  823: 
  824:     {ok,simple,ErrorBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,error}}]), %Coverage
  825:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} =
  826: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [abstract_code]),
  827:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,error}}]}} =
  828: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [debug_info]).
  829: 
  830: custom_compile_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  831:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  832:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,custom_compile_info}],
  833:     Opts = [binary,{compile_info,[{another,version}]}],
  834: 
  835:     {ok,custom_compile_info,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, Opts),
  836:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,CompileInfo}]}} =
  837: 	beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [compile_info]),
  838:     version = proplists:get_value(another, CompileInfo),
  839:     CompileOpts = proplists:get_value(options, CompileInfo),
  840:     undefined = proplists:get_value(compile_info, CompileOpts),
  841: 
  842:     {ok,custom_compile_info,DetBin} = compile:forms(Forms, [deterministic|Opts]),
  843:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,DetInfo}]}} =
  844: 	beam_lib:chunks(DetBin, [compile_info]),
  845:     version = proplists:get_value(another, DetInfo).
  846: 
  847: cover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  848:     io:format("~p\n", [compile:options()]),
  849:     ok.
  850: 
  851: do_listing(Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext) ->
  852:     io:format("Source: ~p TargetDir: ~p\n  Type: ~p Ext: ~p\n",
  853: 	      [Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext]),
  854:     case compile:file(Source, [Type, time, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  855: 	{ok, _} -> ok;
  856: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  857:     end,
  858:     SourceBase = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source)),
  859: 
  860:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, SourceBase ++ Ext),
  861:     true = exists(Target).
  862: 
  863: get_files(Config, Module, OutputName) ->
  864:     code:delete(Module),
  865:     code:purge(Module),
  866:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  867:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  868:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  869:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, OutputName),
  870:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  871:     File = atom_to_list(Module) ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  872:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, File),
  873:     {Src, Target}.
  874: 
  875: run(Target, Func, Args) ->
  876:     Module = list_to_atom(filename:rootname(filename:basename(Target))),
  877:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(Target)),
  878:     Result = (catch apply(Module, Func, Args)),
  879:     true = code:delete(Module),
  880:     false = code:purge(Module),
  881:     Result.
  882: 
  883: exists(Name) ->
  884:     case file:read_file_info(Name) of
  885: 	{ok, _}    -> true;
  886: 	{error, _} -> false
  887:     end.
  888: 
  889: 
  890: strict_record(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  891:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  892:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  893:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
  894:     M = record_access,
  895:  
  896:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  897:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  898: 
  899:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  900:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  901: 
  902:     %% The option first given wins.
  903:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests,strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  904:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  905:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests,no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  906:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  907: 
  908:     %% Default (possibly influenced by ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS).
  909:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [{outdir,Priv},report_errors]),
  910:     try
  911:         {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  912:         {comment,"Default: no_strict_record_tests"}
  913:     catch
  914:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  915:             {comment,"Default: strict_record_tests"}
  916:     end.
  917: 
  918: test_strict() ->
  919:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  920:     try
  921:         record_access:test(Turtle)
  922:     catch
  923:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  924:             ok
  925:     end,
  926:     Turtle.
  927: 
  928: test_sloppy() ->
  929:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  930:     {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  931:     Turtle.
  932: 
  933: utf8_atoms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  934:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  935:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<""/utf8>>, utf8),
  936:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  937: 	     {function,Anno,atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,Atom}]}]}],
  938: 
  939:     Utf8AtomForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_atom}|Forms],
  940:     {ok,utf8_atom,Utf8AtomBin} =
  941: 	compile:forms(Utf8AtomForms, [binary]),
  942:     {ok,{utf8_atom,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  943: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8AtomBin, [atoms]),
  944:     code:load_binary(utf8_atom, "compile_SUITE", Utf8AtomBin),
  945:     Atom = utf8_atom:atom(),
  946:     true = is_atom(Atom),
  947:     ok.
  948: 
  949: utf8_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  950:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  951:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<""/utf8>>, utf8),
  952:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  953: 	     {function,Anno,Atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,world}]}]}],
  954: 
  955:     Utf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_function}|Forms],
  956:     {ok,utf8_function,Utf8FunctionBin} =
  957: 	compile:forms(Utf8FunctionForms, [binary]),
  958:     {ok,{utf8_function,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  959: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8FunctionBin, [atoms]),
  960:     code:load_binary(utf8_function, "compile_SUITE", Utf8FunctionBin),
  961:     world = utf8_function:Atom(),
  962: 
  963:     NoUtf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,no_utf8_function}|Forms],
  964:     error = compile:forms(NoUtf8FunctionForms, [binary, r19]).
  965: 
  966: extra_chunks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  967:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  968:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,extra_chunks}],
  969: 
  970:     {ok,extra_chunks,ExtraChunksBinary} =
  971: 	compile:forms(Forms, [binary, {extra_chunks, [{<<"ExCh">>, <<"Contents">>}]}]),
  972:     {ok,{extra_chunks,[{"ExCh",<<"Contents">>}]}} =
  973: 	beam_lib:chunks(ExtraChunksBinary, ["ExCh"]).
  974: 
  975: tuple_calls(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  976:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  977:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,export,[{size,1},{store,1}]},
  978: 	     {function,Anno,size,1,
  979: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  980: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,size}},
  981:                  []}]}]},
  982: 	     {function,Anno,store,1,
  983: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  984: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,store}},
  985:                  [{atom,Anno,key},{atom,Anno,value}]}]}]}],
  986: 
  987:     TupleCallsFalse = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_false}|Forms],
  988:     {ok,_,TupleCallsFalseBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsFalse, [binary]),
  989:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_false, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsFalseBinary),
  990:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:store(dict())),
  991:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(dict())),
  992:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(empty_tuple())),
  993: 
  994:     TupleCallsTrue = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_true}|Forms],
  995:     {ok,_,TupleCallsTrueBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsTrue, [binary,tuple_calls]),
  996:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_true, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsTrueBinary),
  997:     Dict = tuple_calls_true:store(dict()),
  998:     1 = tuple_calls_true:size(Dict),
  999:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_true:size(empty_tuple())),
 1000: 
 1001:     ok.
 1002: 
 1003: dict() ->
 1004:     dict:new().
 1005: empty_tuple() ->
 1006:     {}.
 1007: 
 1008: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1009:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, env),
 1010:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1011:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
 1012: 
 1013:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "binary"),
 1014:     try
 1015: 	env_1(Simple, Target)
 1016:     after
 1017: 	true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "ignore_me"),
 1018: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1019: 	file:delete(Target),
 1020: 	file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target))
 1021:     end,
 1022:     ok.
 1023: 
 1024: env_1(Simple, Target) ->
 1025:     %% file
 1026:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:file(Simple),
 1027:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, [debug_info]),
 1028:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, debug_info),
 1029: 
 1030:     true = exists(Target),
 1031:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,Abstr0}]}} =
 1032: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [abstract_code]),
 1033:     {raw_abstract_v1,Forms} = Abstr0,
 1034: 
 1035:     %% forms
 1036:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strong_validation"),
 1037:     {ok,simple} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1038:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, []),
 1039: 
 1040:     %% output_generated
 1041:     false = compile:output_generated([]),
 1042:     true = compile:noenv_output_generated([]),
 1043: 
 1044:     ok = file:delete(Target),
 1045: 
 1046:     %% Cover error handling.
 1047:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "'unterminated_atom"),
 1048:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1049:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", ",,,"),
 1050:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1051:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, no_postopt),
 1052: 
 1053:     ok.
 1054: 
 1055: %% Test pretty-printing in Core Erlang format and then try to
 1056: %% compile the generated Core Erlang files.
 1057: 
 1058: core_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1059:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1060:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1061:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1062: 
 1063:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1064:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
 1065: 				    {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} = 
 1066: 			     beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1067: 			 {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
 1068:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_core_pp(F, Outdir) end, Abstr).
 1069:     
 1070: do_core_pp({M,A}, Outdir) ->
 1071:     try
 1072: 	do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir)
 1073:     catch
 1074: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1075: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
 1076: 		      [Error,M]),
 1077: 	    error;
 1078: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1079: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1080: 	    error
 1081:     end.
 1082: 
 1083: do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir) ->
 1084:     {ok,M,Core0} = compile:forms(A, [to_core]),
 1085:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1086:     CorePP = core_pp:format(Core0),
 1087:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1088: 
 1089:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1090:     Core = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1091: 	       {ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1092: 	       Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1093: 	   end,
 1094:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1095: 
 1096:     %% Compile as usual (including optimizations).
 1097:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,binary]),
 1098: 
 1099:     %% Don't optimize to test that we are not dependent
 1100:     %% on the Core Erlang optimization passes.
 1101:     %% (Example of a previous bug: The core_parse pass
 1102:     %% would not turn map literals into #c_literal{}
 1103:     %% records; if sys_core_fold was run it would fix
 1104:     %% that; if sys_core_fold was not run v3_kernel would
 1105:     %% crash.)
 1106:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,no_copt,binary]),
 1107: 
 1108:     ok.
 1109: 
 1110: compile_forms(Mod, Forms, Opts) ->
 1111:     case compile:forms(Forms, [report_errors|Opts]) of
 1112: 	{ok,Mod,_} ->  ok;
 1113: 	Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1114:     end.
 1115: 
 1116: %% Pretty-print core and read it back. Should be identical.
 1117: 
 1118: core_roundtrip(Config) ->
 1119:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1120:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1121:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1122: 
 1123:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1124: 
 1125:     Test = fun(F) -> do_core_roundtrip(F, Outdir) end,
 1126:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1127:         4 ->
 1128:             %% This test case is very memory intensive. Only
 1129:             %% use a single process.
 1130:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams, 1);
 1131:         8 ->
 1132:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams)
 1133:     end.
 1134: 
 1135: do_core_roundtrip(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1136:     try
 1137: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1138: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1139: 	do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1140:     catch
 1141: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1142: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1143: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1144: 	    error;
 1145: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1146: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1147: 	    error
 1148:     end.
 1149: 
 1150: do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1151:     {ok,Mod,Core0} = compile:forms(Abstr, [to_core0]),
 1152:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core0, Outdir),
 1153: 
 1154:     %% Primarily, test that annotations are accepted for all
 1155:     %% constructs. Secondarily, smoke test cerl_trees:label/1.
 1156:     {Core1,_} = cerl_trees:label(Core0),
 1157:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core1, Outdir),
 1158: 
 1159:     %% Run the inliner to force generation of variables
 1160:     %% with numeric names.
 1161:     {ok,Mod,Core2} = compile:forms(Abstr, [inline,to_core]),
 1162:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core2, Outdir).
 1163: 
 1164: do_core_roundtrip_2(M, Core0, Outdir) ->
 1165:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1166:     CorePP = core_pp:format_all(Core0),
 1167:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1168: 
 1169:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1170:     Core2 = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,
 1171: 					 no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1172: 		{ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1173: 		Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1174: 	    end,
 1175:     Core = undo_var_translation(Core2),
 1176:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1177: 
 1178:     case cmp_core(Core0, Core, M) of
 1179: 	true -> ok;
 1180: 	false -> error
 1181:     end.
 1182: 
 1183: undo_var_translation(Tree) ->
 1184:     F = fun(Node) ->
 1185: 		case cerl:is_c_var(Node) of
 1186: 		    true ->
 1187: 			Name0 = cerl:var_name(Node),
 1188: 			try atom_to_list(Name0) of
 1189: 			    "_X"++Name ->
 1190: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1191: 			    "_"++Name ->
 1192: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1193: 			    _ ->
 1194: 				Node
 1195: 			catch
 1196: 			    error:badarg ->
 1197: 				Node
 1198: 
 1199: 			end;
 1200: 		    false ->
 1201: 			Node
 1202: 		end
 1203: 	end,
 1204:     cerl_trees:map(F, Tree).
 1205: 
 1206: cmp_core(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1207:     true;
 1208: cmp_core(M1, M2, Mod) ->
 1209:     cmp_core_fs(cerl:module_defs(M1), cerl:module_defs(M2), Mod).
 1210: 
 1211: cmp_core_fs([F1|T1], [F2|T2], Mod) ->
 1212:     cmp_core_f(F1, F2, Mod) andalso cmp_core_fs(T1, T2, Mod);
 1213: cmp_core_fs([], [], _Mod) ->
 1214:     true;
 1215: cmp_core_fs(_, _, _Mod) ->
 1216:     false.
 1217: 
 1218: cmp_core_f(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1219:     true;
 1220: cmp_core_f({Name,F1}, {Name,F2}, Mod) ->
 1221:     case diff(F1, F2) of
 1222: 	F1 ->
 1223: 	    true;
 1224: 	Diff ->
 1225: 	    io:format("~p ~p:\n~p\n", [Mod,Name,Diff]),
 1226: 	    false
 1227:     end.
 1228: 
 1229: diff(E, E) ->
 1230:     E;
 1231: diff([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
 1232:     [diff(H1, H2)|diff(T1, T2)];
 1233: diff(T1, T2) when tuple_size(T1) =:= tuple_size(T2) ->
 1234:     case cerl:is_c_var(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_var(T2) of
 1235:         true ->
 1236:             diff_var(T1, T2);
 1237:         false ->
 1238:             case cerl:is_c_map(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_map(T2) of
 1239:                 true ->
 1240:                     diff_map(T1, T2);
 1241:                 false ->
 1242:                     diff_tuple(T1, T2)
 1243:             end
 1244:     end;
 1245: diff(E1, E2) ->
 1246:     {'DIFF',E1,E2}.
 1247: 
 1248: diff_var(V1, V2) ->
 1249:     case {cerl:var_name(V1),cerl:var_name(V2)} of
 1250:         {Same,Same} ->
 1251:             V1;
 1252:         {Name1,Name2} ->
 1253:             %% The inliner uses integers as variable names. Such integers
 1254:             %% are read back as atoms.
 1255:             case is_integer(Name1) andalso
 1256:                 list_to_atom(integer_to_list(Name1)) =:= Name2 of
 1257:                 true ->
 1258:                     V1;
 1259:                 _ ->
 1260:                     cerl:update_c_var(V1, {'DIFF',Name1,Name2})
 1261:             end
 1262:     end.
 1263: 
 1264: %% Annotations for maps are not preserved exactly, but that is not
 1265: %% a real problem. Workaround by not comparing all annotations when
 1266: %% comparing maps.
 1267: 
 1268: diff_map(M, M) ->
 1269:     M;
 1270: diff_map(M1, M2) ->
 1271:     case cerl:get_ann(M1) =:= cerl:get_ann(M2) of
 1272:         false ->
 1273:             diff_tuple(M1, M2);
 1274:         true ->
 1275:             case remove_compiler_gen(M1) =:= remove_compiler_gen(M2) of
 1276:                 true ->
 1277:                     M1;
 1278:                 false ->
 1279:                     diff_tuple(M1, M2)
 1280:             end
 1281:     end.
 1282: 
 1283: diff_tuple(T1, T2) ->
 1284:     L = diff(tuple_to_list(T1), tuple_to_list(T2)),
 1285:     list_to_tuple(L).
 1286: 
 1287: remove_compiler_gen(M) ->
 1288:     Arg0 = cerl:map_arg(M),
 1289:     Arg = cerl:set_ann(Arg0, []),
 1290:     Es0 = cerl:map_es(M),
 1291:     Es = [remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) || Pair <- Es0],
 1292:     cerl:update_c_map(M, Arg, Es).
 1293: 
 1294: remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) ->
 1295:     Op0 = cerl:map_pair_op(Pair),
 1296:     Op = cerl:set_ann(Op0, []),
 1297:     K = map_var(cerl:map_pair_key(Pair)),
 1298:     V = map_var(cerl:map_pair_val(Pair)),
 1299:     cerl:update_c_map_pair(Pair, Op, K, V).
 1300: 
 1301: map_var(Var) ->
 1302:     case cerl:is_c_var(Var) of
 1303:         true ->
 1304:             case cerl:var_name(Var) of
 1305:                 Name when is_atom(Name) ->
 1306:                     L = atom_to_list(Name),
 1307:                     try list_to_integer(L) of
 1308:                         Int ->
 1309:                             cerl:update_c_var(Var, Int)
 1310:                     catch
 1311:                         error:_ ->
 1312:                             Var
 1313:                     end;
 1314:                 _ ->
 1315:                     Var
 1316:             end;
 1317:         false ->
 1318:             Var
 1319:     end.
 1320: 
 1321: %% Compile to Beam assembly language (.S) and then try to
 1322: %% run .S through the compiler again.
 1323: 
 1324: asm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1325:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1326:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm"),
 1327:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1328: 
 1329:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1330:     Res = test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_asm(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams),
 1331:     Res.
 1332: 
 1333:     
 1334: do_asm(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1335:     {ok,{M,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,A}}]}} =
 1336: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1337:     try
 1338:         Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(M),
 1339: 	{ok,M,Asm} = compile:forms(A, ['S'|Opts]),
 1340: 	AsmFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".S"),
 1341: 	{ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1342: 	beam_listing:module(Fd, Asm),
 1343: 	ok = file:close(Fd),
 1344:         case compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,binary,report|Opts]) of
 1345: 	    {ok,M,_} ->
 1346: 		ok = file:delete(AsmFile);
 1347: 	    Other ->
 1348: 		io:format("*** failure '~p' for ~s\n",
 1349: 			  [Other,AsmFile]),
 1350: 		error
 1351: 	end
 1352:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
 1353: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1354: 	    error
 1355:     end.
 1356: 
 1357: %% Compile a crafted file which produces the three call instructions
 1358: %% which should have a comment with the called function in clear
 1359: %% text. We check that the expected functions and comments occur in
 1360: %% the listing.
 1361: 
 1362: asm_labels(Config) ->
 1363:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1364:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1365:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "asm_labels.erl"),
 1366:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm_labels"),
 1367:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "asm_labels.S"),
 1368:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 1369:     {ok,asm_labels} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 1370:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 1371:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 1372:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1373:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_only,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1374:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_last,.+,{f,.+},.+}\\. % bar/1)", Os),
 1375:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 1376: 
 1377: sys_pre_attributes(Config) ->
 1378:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1379:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "attributes.erl"),
 1380:     Mod = attributes,
 1381:     CommonOpts = [binary,report,verbose,
 1382: 		  {parse_transform,sys_pre_attributes}],
 1383:     PreOpts = [{attribute,delete,deleted}],
 1384:     PostOpts = [{attribute,insert,inserted,"value"}],
 1385:     PrePostOpts = [{attribute,replace,replaced,42},
 1386: 		   {attribute,replace,replace_nonexisting,new}],
 1387:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1388: 				     PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1389:     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Code),
 1390:     Attr = Mod:module_info(attributes),
 1391:     io:format("~p", [Attr]),
 1392:     {inserted,"value"} = lists:keyfind(inserted, 1, Attr),
 1393:     {replaced,[42]} = lists:keyfind(replaced, 1, Attr),
 1394:     {replace_nonexisting,[new]} = lists:keyfind(replace_nonexisting, 1, Attr),
 1395:     false = lists:keymember(deleted, 1, Attr),
 1396: 
 1397:     %% Cover more code.
 1398:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1399:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, CommonOpts -- [verbose]),
 1400:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PreOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1401:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File,
 1402: 			      [{attribute,replace,replaced,42}|CommonOpts]),
 1403:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1404: 				  PostOpts ++ CommonOpts --
 1405: 				  [report,verbose]),
 1406:     ok.
 1407: 
 1408: %% Test the dialyzer option to cover more code.
 1409: dialyzer(Config) ->
 1410:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1411:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1412:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
 1413:     M = dialyzer_test,
 1414:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [dialyzer|Opts]),
 1415:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1416: 
 1417:     %% Cover huge line numbers without the 'dialyzer' option.
 1418:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
 1419:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1420:     ok.
 1421: 
 1422: 
 1423: %% Test that warnings contain filenames and line numbers.
 1424: warnings(_Config) ->
 1425:     Files = get_unique_files(".erl"),
 1426:     test_lib:p_run(fun do_warnings/1, Files).
 1427: 
 1428: do_warnings(F) ->
 1429:     Options = [{feature,maybe_expr,enable},binary,bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info,return],
 1430:     {ok,_,_,Ws} = compile:file(F, Options),
 1431:     do_warnings_1(Ws, F).
 1432: 
 1433: do_warnings_1([{"no_file",Ws}|_], F) ->
 1434:     io:format("~s:\nMissing file for warnings: ~p\n",
 1435: 	      [F,Ws]),
 1436:     error;
 1437: do_warnings_1([{Name,Ws}|T], F) ->
 1438:     case filename:extension(Name) of
 1439: 	".erl" ->
 1440: 	    do_warnings_2(Ws, T, F);
 1441: 	_ ->
 1442: 	    io:format("~s:\nNo .erl extension\n", [F]),
 1443: 	    error
 1444:     end;
 1445: do_warnings_1([], _) -> ok.
 1446: 
 1447: do_warnings_2([{Pos,_,_}=W|T], Next, F) ->
 1448:     case Pos of
 1449: 	Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1450: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1451: 	{Line,Col} when is_integer(Line), is_integer(Col) ->
 1452: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1453: 	true ->
 1454: 	    io:format("~s:\nMissing line number: ~p\n",
 1455: 		      [F,W]),
 1456: 	    error
 1457:     end;
 1458: do_warnings_2([], Next, F) ->
 1459:     do_warnings_1(Next, F).
 1460: 
 1461: message_printing(Config) ->
 1462:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1463:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1464: 
 1465:     BadEncFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_enc.erl"),
 1466:     {error,BadEncErrors, []} = compile:file(BadEncFile, [return]),
 1467: 
 1468:     [":7:15: cannot parse file, giving up\n"
 1469:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1470:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1471:     ,
 1472:      ":7:15: cannot translate from UTF-8\n"
 1473:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1474:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1475:     ] = messages(BadEncErrors),
 1476: 
 1477:     UTF8File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_utf8.erl"),
 1478:     {ok,_,UTF8Errors} = compile:file(UTF8File, [return]),
 1479:     [":5:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1480:      "%    5|     B = <<\"xyz\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1481:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1482:     ] = messages(UTF8Errors),
 1483: 
 1484:     Latin1File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_lat1.erl"),
 1485:     {ok,_,Latin1Errors} = compile:file(Latin1File, [return]),
 1486:     [":6:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1487:      "%    6|     B = <<\"xyz\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1488:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1489:     ] = messages(Latin1Errors),
 1490: 
 1491:     LongFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "long.erl"),
 1492:     Long = ["-module(long).\n",
 1493:             "-export([foo/0]).\n",
 1494:             "unused() -> ok.\n",
 1495:             lists:duplicate(10000, $\n),
 1496:             "foo() -> bar().\n"],
 1497:     ok = file:write_file(LongFile, Long),
 1498:     {error,LongErrors,LongWarnings} = compile:file(LongFile, [return]),
 1499:     [":10004:10: function bar/0 undefined\n"
 1500:      "% 10004| foo() -> bar().\n"
 1501:      "%      |          ^\n\n"
 1502:     ] = messages(LongErrors),
 1503:     [":3:1: function unused/0 is unused\n"
 1504:      "%    3| unused() -> ok.\n"
 1505:      "%     | ^\n\n"
 1506:     ] = messages(LongWarnings),
 1507:     ok = file:delete(LongFile),
 1508: 
 1509:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1510:     try
 1511:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1512:         {ok,cover_messages,_} = compile:file(cover_messages, [report, binary])
 1513:     after
 1514:         file:set_cwd(OldCwd)
 1515:     end,
 1516: 
 1517:     ok.
 1518: 
 1519: messages(Errors) ->
 1520:     lists:flatmap(fun ({{File,_L},Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs);
 1521:                       ({File,Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs)
 1522:                   end,
 1523:                   Errors).
 1524: 
 1525: format_descs(File, Descs) ->
 1526:     [strip_prefix(File, lists:flatten(Text))
 1527:      || {_Where, Text} <- sys_messages:format_messages(File, "", Descs, [])].
 1528: 
 1529: strip_prefix(Prefix, String) ->
 1530:     case string:prefix(String, Prefix) of
 1531:         nomatch -> String;
 1532:         Rest -> Rest
 1533:     end.
 1534: 
 1535: %% Test that the compile:pre_load/0 function (used by 'erlc')
 1536: %% pre-loads the modules that are used by a typical compilation.
 1537: 
 1538: pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1539:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1540:         true ->
 1541:             {skip,"Cover is running"};
 1542:         false ->
 1543:             try
 1544:                 do_pre_load_check(Config)
 1545:             after
 1546:                 dbg:stop()
 1547:             end
 1548:     end.
 1549: 
 1550: do_pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1551:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 1552:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1553:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big.erl"),
 1554:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun pre_load_trace/2,[]}),
 1555:     dbg:p(self(), call),
 1556:     dbg:p(new, call),
 1557:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl({?MODULE,get_trace_data,0}, []),
 1558:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}, []),
 1559: 
 1560:     %% Compile a simple module using the erl_compile interface
 1561:     %% to find out the modules that are pre-loaded by
 1562:     %% compile:pre_load/0.
 1563:     Opts = #options{specific=[binary]},
 1564:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "", Opts),
 1565:     [{code,ensure_modules_loaded,[PreLoaded0]}] = get_trace_data(),
 1566:     PreLoaded1 = ordsets:from_list(PreLoaded0),
 1567: 
 1568:     %% Since 'compile' is the function doing the pre-loaded,
 1569:     %% it is useless to include it in the list.
 1570:     case ordsets:is_element(compile, PreLoaded1) of
 1571: 	true ->
 1572: 	    io:put_chars("The 'compile' module should not be included "
 1573: 			 "in the list of modules to be pre-loaded."),
 1574: 	    ct:fail(compile);
 1575: 	false ->
 1576: 	    []
 1577:     end,
 1578:     PreLoaded = ordsets:add_element(compile, PreLoaded1),
 1579: 
 1580:     %% Now unload all pre-loaded modules and all modules in
 1581:     %% compiler application. Then compile a module to find
 1582:     %% which modules that get loaded.
 1583:     CompilerMods = compiler_modules(),
 1584:     Unload = ordsets:union(ordsets:from_list(CompilerMods), PreLoaded),
 1585:     _ = [begin
 1586: 	     code:delete(M),
 1587: 	     code:purge(M)
 1588: 	 end || M <- Unload],
 1589: 
 1590:     {ok,_} = dbg:ctp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}),
 1591:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_loaded,1}, []),
 1592:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary]),
 1593:     WasLoaded0 = get_trace_data(),
 1594:     WasLoaded1 = [M || {code,ensure_loaded,[M]} <- WasLoaded0],
 1595:     WasLoaded = ordsets:from_list(WasLoaded1),
 1596: 
 1597:     %% Check for modules that should have been pre-loaded.
 1598:     case ordsets:subtract(WasLoaded, PreLoaded) of
 1599: 	[] ->
 1600: 	    ok;
 1601: 	[_|_]=NotPreLoaded ->
 1602: 	    io:format("The following modules were used "
 1603: 		      "but not pre-loaded:\n~p\n",
 1604: 		      [NotPreLoaded]),
 1605: 	    ct:fail({not_preload,NotPreLoaded})
 1606:     end,
 1607: 
 1608:     %% Check for modules that should not be pre-loaded.
 1609:     case ordsets:subtract(PreLoaded, WasLoaded) of
 1610: 	[] ->
 1611: 	    ok;
 1612: 	[_|_]=NotUsed ->
 1613: 	    io:format("The following modules were pre-loaded"
 1614: 		      " but not used:\n~p\n",
 1615: 		      [NotUsed]),
 1616: 	    ct:fail({not_used,NotUsed})
 1617:     end,
 1618: 
 1619:     ok.
 1620: 
 1621: get_trace_data() ->
 1622:     %% Apparantely, doing a receive at the beginning of
 1623:     %% a traced function can cause extra trace messages.
 1624:     %% To avoid that, don't do the receive in this function.
 1625:     do_get_trace_data().
 1626: 
 1627: do_get_trace_data() ->
 1628:     receive
 1629: 	{trace_data,Data} -> Data
 1630:     end.
 1631: 
 1632: pre_load_trace({trace,Pid,call,{?MODULE,get_trace_data,[]}}, Acc) ->
 1633:     Pid ! {trace_data,Acc},
 1634:     [];
 1635: pre_load_trace({trace,_,call,MFA}, Acc) ->
 1636:     [MFA|Acc].
 1637: 
 1638: compiler_modules() ->
 1639:     Wc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler),"ebin","*.beam"]),
 1640:     Ms = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 1641:     FN = filename,
 1642:     [list_to_atom(FN:rootname(FN:basename(M), ".beam")) || M <- Ms].
 1643: 
 1644: %% Test that ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS are correctly retrieved
 1645: %% by env_compiler_options/0
 1646: 
 1647: env_compiler_options(_Config) ->
 1648:     Cases = [
 1649:         {"bin_opt_info", [bin_opt_info]},
 1650:         {"recv_opt_info", [recv_opt_info]},
 1651:         {"'S'", ['S']},
 1652:         {"{source, \"test.erl\"}", [{source, "test.erl"}]},
 1653:         {"[{d,macro_one,1},{d,macro_two}]", [{d, macro_one, 1}, {d, macro_two}]},
 1654:         {"[warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]", [warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]}
 1655:     ],
 1656:     F = fun({Env, Expected}) ->
 1657:         true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", Env),
 1658:         Expected = compile:env_compiler_options()
 1659:     end,
 1660:     lists:foreach(F, Cases).
 1661: 
 1662: %% Test options for compatibility with previous major versions of OTP.
 1663: 
 1664: bc_options(Config) ->
 1665:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1666: 
 1667:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1668: 
 1669:     L = [{171, small_float, [no_line_info,
 1670:                              no_ssa_opt_float,
 1671:                              no_type_opt]},
 1672:          {171, small_float, [no_line_info]},
 1673:          {171, small_float, []},
 1674:          {171, small_float, [r24]},
 1675:          {171, small_float, [r25]},
 1676: 
 1677:          {172, small, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1678:                        no_ssa_opt_float,
 1679:                        no_line_info,
 1680:                        no_type_opt,
 1681:                        no_bs_match]},
 1682:          {172, small, [r24]},
 1683: 
 1684:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1685:                       no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1686:                       no_type_opt]},
 1687:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1688:                       no_line_info,
 1689:                       no_stack_trimming,
 1690:                       no_type_opt]},
 1691:          {172, funs, [r24]},
 1692: 
 1693:          {172, small_maps, [r24]},
 1694:          {172, small_maps, [no_type_opt]},
 1695: 
 1696:          {172, big, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1697:                      no_ssa_opt_float,
 1698:                      no_line_info,
 1699:                      no_type_opt]},
 1700:          {172, big, [r24]},
 1701: 
 1702:          {178, small, [r25]},
 1703:          {178, big, [r25]},
 1704:          {178, funs, []},
 1705:          {178, big, []}
 1706:         ],
 1707: 
 1708:     Test = fun({Expected,Mod,Options}) ->
 1709:                    case highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Options) of
 1710:                        Expected ->
 1711:                            ok;
 1712:                        Got ->
 1713:                            io:format("*** module ~p, options ~p => got ~p; expected ~p\n",
 1714:                                      [Mod,Options,Got,Expected]),
 1715:                            error
 1716:                    end
 1717:            end,
 1718:     test_lib:p_run(Test, L),
 1719:     ok.
 1720: 
 1721: highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Opt) ->
 1722:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
 1723:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Src, [binary,report_errors|Opt]),
 1724:     test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam).
 1725: 
 1726: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1727:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1728:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1729:  
 1730:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if their include paths do,
 1731:     %% as their debug info will be different.
 1732:     {ok,_,NonDetA} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1733:     {ok,_,NonDetB} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1734:     true = NonDetA =/= NonDetB,
 1735: 
 1736:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1737:     {ok,_,DetC} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1738:     {ok,_,DetD} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1739:     true = DetC =:= DetD,
 1740: 
 1741:     ok.
 1742: 
 1743: deterministic_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1744:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1745: 
 1746:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if they were compiled from a
 1747:     %% different directory.
 1748:     true = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", []),
 1749: 
 1750:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1751:     false = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", [deterministic]),
 1752: 
 1753:     ok.
 1754: 
 1755: deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1756:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1757:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1758:     try
 1759:         {ok,_,A} = compile:file(Simple, [binary | Opts]),
 1760:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1761:         {ok,_,B} = compile:file(Name, [binary | Opts]),
 1762:         A =/= B
 1763:     after
 1764:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1765:     end.
 1766: 
 1767: %% ERL-1058: -compile(debug_info) had no effect
 1768: compile_attribute(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1769:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1770: 
 1771:     %% The test module has a -compile([debug_info]). attribute, which means
 1772:     %% debug information should always be included.
 1773:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", [debug_info]),
 1774:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", []),
 1775: 
 1776:     ok.
 1777: 
 1778: debug_info_attribute(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1779:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
 1780:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary | Opts]),
 1781:     {ok, {_, Attrs}} = beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [debug_info]),
 1782: 
 1783:     [{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code, {Forms, _}}}] = Attrs,
 1784:     [{attribute,{1,1},file,{_,1}},
 1785:      {attribute,{1,2},module,debug_info},
 1786:      {attribute,{2,2},compile,[debug_info]},
 1787:      {eof,_}] = forms_to_terms(Forms),
 1788: 
 1789:     ok.
 1790: 
 1791: forms_to_terms(Forms) ->
 1792:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 1793: 
 1794: %% Test compiler options not tested in other test cases.
 1795: other_options(Config) ->
 1796:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1797: 
 1798:     %% Smoke test of no_spawn_compiler_process, brief, and absolute_source
 1799:     %% options.
 1800:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1801:     {ok,big,<<_/binary>>} =
 1802:         compile:file(Big, [binary,
 1803:                            no_spawn_compiler_process,
 1804:                            brief,
 1805:                            absolute_source,
 1806:                            report]),
 1807: 
 1808:     %% Test generating a compressed BEAM file. Also cover the redundant
 1809:     %% `beam` option and the `no_inline` option.
 1810:     Small = filename:join(DataDir, "small"),
 1811:     {ok,small} = compile:file(Small, [report, no_inline, compressed, beam]),
 1812: 
 1813:     ok.
 1814: 
 1815: %% Test core transforms and parse transforms.
 1816: transforms(Config) ->
 1817:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1818:     try
 1819:         do_transforms(Config)
 1820:     after
 1821:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1822:     end.
 1823: 
 1824: do_transforms(Config) ->
 1825:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1826:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1827:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1828:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1829:     ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
 1830: 
 1831:     %% Compile our parse transforms.
 1832:     LinePt = filename:join(DataDir, "line_pt"),
 1833:     {ok,line_pt} = compile:file(LinePt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1834:     ColumnPt = filename:join(DataDir, "column_pt"),
 1835:     {ok,column_pt} = compile:file(ColumnPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1836:     GenericPt = filename:join(DataDir, "generic_pt"),
 1837:     {ok,generic_pt} = compile:file(GenericPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1838: 
 1839:     %% Compile a file using line_pt and verify that column numbers
 1840:     %% have been stripped.
 1841:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1842:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1843: 
 1844:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and verify that column numbers
 1845:     %% have NOT been stripped.
 1846:     {[_|_],[]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1847: 
 1848:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and error_location=line and verify
 1849:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1850:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1851:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1852: 
 1853:     %% Compile a file using column_pt, line_pt and verify
 1854:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1855:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt},
 1856:                                                   {parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1857: 
 1858:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1859:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1860:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1861:                                                   add_columns,
 1862:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1863: 
 1864:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1865:     %% then call column_pt again to check that columns are stripped in between calls.
 1866:     %% and then verify that column numbers have been stripped from output.
 1867:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1868:                                                   add_columns,
 1869:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt},
 1870:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1871: 
 1872:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and en error and error_location=line and
 1873:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1874:     {error,[{_What,[{Line,_,_}]}],[_|_]} =
 1875:         compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1876:                                          add_columns,
 1877:                                          add_error,
 1878:                                          {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1879:     true = is_integer(Line),
 1880: 
 1881:     %% Cover transform code implementing the `time` option.
 1882:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary, time, report,
 1883:                                     {core_transform,generic_pt},
 1884:                                     {parse_transform,generic_pt}]),
 1885: 
 1886:     %% Test exceptions from a core transform.
 1887:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, simple),
 1888:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1889:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1890: 
 1891:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1892:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1893: 
 1894:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1895:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1896: 
 1897:     %% Test exceptions from a parse transform.
 1898:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1899:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1900: 
 1901:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1902:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1903: 
 1904:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1905:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1906: 
 1907:     %% Test generating errors and warnings in a parse_transform.
 1908:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1909:     {ok,simple,[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
